events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at a busy intersection involving their vehicle and another car.
The claim has been reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to collision involving the insured vehicle.
An agent with expertise in auto accident claims has been assigned to handle the clientâ€™s case promptly.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that investigation will start shortly.
Customer was asked to provide police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and medical reports to proceed.
All requested documents including the police report and photos were submitted by the customer for review.
The investigation into the vehicle collision and liability began with an inspection of submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded that the other driver was at fault and the claim is valid under policy terms.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and medical expenses was proposed to the claimant for approval.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and proposed settlement terms.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance adjuster following customer acceptance of settlement.
Payment for vehicle repair and medical bills was issued to the customer and related service providers.
The claim was formally closed after receipt confirmation of payment and no outstanding issues reported.
All documents and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference.
